text:
Mario Kart DS. The controls and drifting are top notch. Really fun game on the go. Great character selection. Amazing courses. Favorite character is Bowser, but if Waluigi appears then he is #1. Bowser because he has good stats and Waluigi because he is Waluigi. Favorite course from each game I have played
SNES: Rainbow Road. The only memorable track in my opinion, apart from maybe the Mario circuit tracks. Also had great music
64: Choco Mountain. This course was really fun as there was a lot of action and at one point you can fall really behind.
GCN: Mushroom City: The ability of multiple paths makes this course unique. There is yoshi valley too, but that course seemed bland, while this course also has cars to deal with.
DS. Tie between Tick Tock Clock and Bowser’s castle. Tick Tock Clock has jaunty music, has fun gimmicks, and I like how it is based off of Tick stock Clock from SM64. Bowser’s castle has some cool elements and the best bowser’s castle music.
8: Mario Circuit. Truly the definition of anti-gravity in this game. Kind of odd to see peach’s castle upside down. Out of all the Mario kart peach’s castles, this one is the best.
Never Played GBA, Wii, or 7.

author: Sentimentation

text:
It is astonishing - we share exactly the same thoughts about the series. It goes down to details like favourite drivers in SMK (Koopa) und MK64 (Toad). I also think MKWii was the worst game - it was just constant chaos. The nailed the balance between racing and frantic mayhem in MK64. SMK was all about racing and MKWii was all about explosions ans annoying, overlapping sounds. I also hated how you could not adjust the music volume against the SFX. Double Dash was not as bad, but not great either.

With the handheld entires, we have the same opinion too. Super Circuit lacked the multiplayer aspect. MK7 ist totally forgettable imo, but MKDS is one of the best games in the series. I spent many hours in LAN-mode, wich basically is couch acion, but with even more people (up to 8, I think). And then it had the incredible challenge-mode which was highly addictive. I can not understand why this mode has not returned since.

MK8 is indeed an incredible package and I espacially like the way they treat DLC (as you so well put it: "DLC done right!" The one thing I do not like is the balancing. When you are in first place, there is not much that can harm you. But the did so much right, also regarding the items. The tracks are among the best of the series and the soundtrack is superb.

I think I would rank the games like this:
MKDS > MK8 > MK64> SMK > MKDD > MK7 > MKSC > MKWii

author: The Destati

text:
It's good to have you back Supra! Great franchise for a x00 entry. Now the answers:

1) I was a great fan of MKDS because it was the last one to really feel like a step forward for the franchise by introducing a lot of new features to the table (online multiplayer, the missions...). Now I'm torn between that one and MK8, since this one feels like the crowning of all previous entries. The best graphics, the best online, the best music, the best gameplay, bringing new Nintendo franchises with DLC, it's all perfect save for the lack of battle arenas.
2) Back in the day I was a DK/Wario guy, but in the latest entries I've been using Metal Mario the most.
3) I would say Rainbow Road 64 brings some of the best memories for me, and its remake for MK8 although shorter is awesome as well.
4) Yes, but when I found out there was no drifting or items I jumped right back to good ol' videogames!

author: daneofurexistence

text:
1) My favorite has to be Mario Kart DS. While I played quite a lot with other versions, with this one I had more multiplayer games with people at work. We used a round table to gather and have a solid hour of nonstop racing.

2) I try to pick Wario or Waluigi if they're available, although I always get Toad when getting a feel for the circuits and handling of a new game.

3) I have a soft spot for the circuits and music of Bowser's Castle in almost all versions, but yeah, all tracks are good and it's hard to pick.

4) Tried once, didn't like it. I don't like driving or "going fast" in real life, specially if I'm driving.

Bonus 5) Favorite anecdote related to Mario Kart? One of my ex-coworkers started bragging about how good at Mario Kart he was and how hard he was to beat. Another one replied that he wasn't bad himself so they decided to have a friendly competition and I tagged along. Game of choice was Double Dash. At the start of the first race, the "not so bad myself" guy wooshed into the horizon leaving the bragging guy behind. He naver caught up.

author: Python

text:
1. My all time favorite is definitely Mario Kart Wii- I've played that game so much more than any of the others and really enjoyed racing online against other players, since I don't get to play with anyone offline.
If I did have people to play with offline, Double Dash would be my all time choice, just because it was the first one I played, and featured some cool things that weren't featured in any of the other games. The only thing that it needed to overtake MKWii is the online playability, which wasn't available on the GameCube.
I love playing Mario Kart 8 now that Wi-Fi is down, though the game stresses me out far more than the previous games did. As long as that remains an issue, I'll keep my top at MKWii.
2. Yoshi all the time! Back in Double Dash I mained as Red Paratroopa and Toad because I really enjoyed their specials, but otherwise in every other game I always choose Yoshi.
3. My favorite tracks tend to be Rainbow Road levels, Snowy/ice levels (MOUNT WARIO IS BEAST), and levels relating to Yoshi. Even though you didn't ask, some of the courses I dislike have "circuit" in the name. I'm not sure why I don't like them, but I don't tend to choose them over other courses. (Yeah, this includes GCN Yoshi Circuit as well, despite it being a Yoshi themed stage) Although I'm really happy they brought back that level as a DLC! Who would've thought that dlc would be so interesting with Mario Kart?
4. I think I've gone outdoor karting before. There's this Family Fun Center near my house that has a track with some karts, though I'm not sure if it was actually go-karting or if it was something lesser. I never really checked before.

text:
My favorite in the series is Mario Kart DS actually.  Couch multiplayer is always fun, but there was something about portable, go-anywhere online Mario Kart that took me in for a good two years.  Plus it had a ton of features and unlockables which was new to the series at the time (also loved the "event matches").
I always use Mario, cause he's balanced very well.  But my favorite "character" in the games is probably Shy Guy, relatively new to the series.
Favorite track without hesitation is Waluigi Pinball.
Kart Racing venues are pretty common in South New Jersey actually haha.  Yeah, I've been in plenty of kart racing.

Great pick, Supra.  Good memories shared.

text:

author: myohel0

text:

author: Doughboy123x

text: For 'couch multiplayer' I'd say Double Dash wins. As a tradition, I still play it every time my friend (who now lives abroad) comes back to visit, so it holds a special significance. However, MK7 is the best game in the series by some distance, in my opinion. It was already impressive that MKDS handled effortlessly with just a D-pad, but now, with the circle pad for MK7, the control is so unbelievably perfect. I actually prefer it to a control stick, for MK at least, because the range of motion is smaller and more comfortable. The only downside is a fairly disappointing roster of characters; for example, they didn't use Waluigi or Birdo, but kept Daisy. Who cares about Daisy? WHO CARES? Nonetheless, you're missing out by not trying it. If you like 8, you might like 7 just as much, if not even more. The handling in 8 feels a little stiffer, in my opinion, and the tracks are so overloaded with detail that it makes my eyes want to fall out.
